transcript.content: The senate will come to order.
Sergeant at arms will close the door as members will go to their seats.
Members and guests in the gallery please silence all electronic devices.
Leading the senate in prayers is
Reverend Peter Miller in our senate
Chaplin all members and guests in the gallery will please stand.
Let's pray.
Lord we come to
you stumbling and in
need of you to
know that it needs times of
darkness that everything you send
into our lives everything is
because of your great love for
you'll bring redemption even to
this intersection of faith
and politics because you're
a redeemer we ask
you to open our eyes to
see that work and to see
you today is in Jesus name we pray Amen.
Senator Apodaca is recognized for a motion.
thank you Mr President journal of
Friday September 4th 2015 has
been examined and is found to be correct.
I move that Senate dispense with
the reading of the journal
and that it stand approved as written.
With out objection the journal for September 4th stands approved as written.
Senators we have today leaves of
absence granted today for Senators
Blue, Hartsell, Lowe, Robinson, and
Smith and Smith Ingram.
Senators upon the motion of senator
Jim Davis of Mecken county the
chair is happy to extend courtesies
of the gallery to Cooper Smolly Eagle scout.
Winders Moris his mother Thomas,
Simion charter organization representative from Jackson county.
If you're all here please stand and be recognized.
Thank for joining us in the
Senate today.
Senator Apodaca for what purpose do you arise?
Motion relative to calendar Senator Apodaca you've the floor.
Thank you Mr President, members Senate
bill 238 stalking by
GPS is on the calendar
for concurrence move that it
be removed from the calendar report
to the committee on rules Without objection so ordered.
So senator that means that we
only have one bill on calendar
today for concurring senate bill
378, the clerk will
read.
Senate bill 378 increase punishment
does mean death by vehicle.
Senator Bingham is recognized.
Thank you Mr. President, ladies and
gentlemen I would ask
you to not concur, we've got
one other chance we want
to make the AAC and the
DAs happy.
Thank you very Senator Bingham asked
that you do not concur do we have any further discussion or debate?
Hearing none question before the
senate is the motion to concur in
the house committee substitute senate bill
378 all in favor will vote
aye, opposed will vote no,
five seconds will be allowed for the voting clerk to record the vote.
Stine no.
Zero having voted in the
affirmative and 42 in
the negative the senate does not
concur on the house committee substitute
senate bill 378 and the house will be notified.
And that is it for our
calendar of the day, do we have any notices or announcements?
Senator Davis for what purpose do you rise?
For a moment of personal of personal privilege at the appropriate time.
Senator Davis you have the floor.
Thank you Mr President, ladies
and gentlemen you're introduced to
my constituent Coopers Mauley who
the Eagles comes from Silver I
like to tell you a
little bit about this young man,
he is a 10th grader at Lord
and Liberty Academy in Sewer North
Carolina, he has accomplished
quite a lot in his 15 years of life.
Cooper is involved in scouting
since he was six, he started
out as a cab now he's an Eagle scout.
He has 35 merit badges
and to put that into perspective
our sergeant at arms came
here only here in 27 I
understand, and senator Curtis 24.
Of course that's compared
to zero from yours truly
unfortunately I was near Casablanca, Morocco
with my military dad at that time so I didn't have any.
The spirit badge to earn was
shot gun shooting and doing
that one sure we didn't
[xx] His least favorite
was environmental science because he'd
to sit in a classroom for eight
hours with only 30 free time for the outdoors and parked.
Cooper's Eagle scout service project
was sponsored by the Lions club in Silver.
For three years he assisted with
the placement of patriotics flags
in the downtown area, for all
patriotic holidays, and over
the decades the flag holders had
fallen into disrepair Cooper noticed
the problem long before he
became an Eagle scouter and
he determined that one day
he was going to do
something about that and he
was going to refabrish the flash
holders, so they they
would fly straight and proud.
The boys scout has traditionally been
considered to have three promises
and those are duty to
guard country, duty to other people and duty to self.
Duty to God and country Cooper
your family and religious leaders
have taught you to know and
serve God and by following
these teachings you're doing your duty to God.
Men and women of the past
worked to make America great and
many gave their lives for their
country by being a
good family member and a
good citizen working for
your country's good and obeying it's laws.
You are doing your duty to your country.
Duty to other people?
Many people need help a
cheery smile and a helping
hand make life easier for others.
By doing a good turn daily
and helping when you're needed,
you have proven yourselves of a
scout and do your
part to make this a better world.
Duty to self.
Keeping yourself physically strong means taking care of your body.
Eat the right food and build your strength.
Staying mentally awake means learning
all you can, be curious and ask questions.
Being morally straight means life
with honesty, to be clean
in your speech and actions
and to be a person of strong character.
Cooper, your life is an impressive example of these three promises.
You honor this assembly by being here with us today.
Congratulations.
Senator Tillman, for what purpose do you rise?
Mr. President a moment of personal privilege.
Senator Tillman, you have the floor.
Thank you This weekend I
decided to take a
little getaway from this
place, and I went
through some country that I
had never seen before how many
of you actually know where Fontana Dam is?
Okay, that's more than I thought.
How many have actually been there?
Alright.
Let's go with a harder one.
How many of you know what county it's in?
No, no, no.
Tom, you should one senator
knows not even the one
that represents Fontanadam senator Davis
you don't know where Fontanadam is?
Senator Davis do you yield for a question?
I will be glad to yield for a question.
I've a question.yes.is
in your district and what county it's in.
As a matter of fact anybody
that knows anything about Fontana Dam
two county's thank you sir.
Next is Senator Davis, but
village of Fontana Dam is in one county.
I don't want to discuss it.
You probably know but I
know that I only saw what
I will tell you is something that you don't know.
The actual citizens times, quit
gooing up there because it's way past nowhere.
To get a newspaper which I have.
To have to the SA[sp?]
students down I had to
go 12 miles down the mountain to Willshead[sp?]
Grocery.
Now here it is, early in
the morning and they have two papers
there so you know business is not good.
Two papers, I got one
of them, stuff before dollars.
And the paper didn't have much
in it though I [xx] well to see if there's anything there about you.
It normally is, but we
did go back to
Hendersonville and get
a bushel of apples, but if
you go up there, I saw
counties like Graham, Swain,
Henderson, Buncombe and there's
a couple more up there that
I can't remember but you better
know where you're going if you want to get there.
And there must have been about 1000
motorcycles up there and I
found out why they all love to go up there.
I love those
mountains, you can go about
two or 300 in about 12 miles.
you ever driven up there?
It's quite a place.
And there's nobody up there, there's
no people up there.
They kept their resort area was
filled but there wasn't anybody else in those little villages.
You couldn't see anything but motorcycles.
But it's a good trip if you want to get away.
Phones don't work up there
either thought you
all know that Senator Brown for what purpose do you rise?
I don't have
followed it, but an announcement please You have the floor senator.
First of all republicans
will call this immediately after session
and congratulations Cooper from an Eagle scout.
Senator Tuck for what purpose do you rise?
Moment of personal privilege.
Senator Tudor you have the floor.
Thank you Mr. President.
Members since we're talking about
Eagle scouts I thought I would
mention my daughter who has
a gold award winner which is
the girl scout one of
Eagle and a person
she's been dating for the past
three years who happens to be
an Eagle scout and is the
only reason I approved announce
their engagement Saturday to be married.
Senator Pitt for what purpose do you rise?
For a short moment of personal privilege.
You have the floor senator Pitt.
I would move that the
words uttered by senator
Davis about the Eagle
Scout about a [xx] we
spread upon the journal.
Thank you senator.
Do we have any other notices announcements?
Any further business come for the senate?
If not the chair recognizes senator Berger for a motion.
Mr. President I'm with the
senate do now adjourn subject
to the stipulation set
forth in senate rule 24.1
ratification of bills, appointment of
conferees receipt of conference reports
and we'll see they past messages
to reconvene on Wednesday September
9th 2015 at 2pm.
The motion now
adjourned subject to the stipulation,
stated by Senator Burger so we
convene September 9th at 2 PM.
Seconded by Senator Sunderson,
all in favor say I those no.
The ayes have it the senate stands adjourned.
